summary: This is an FBI 302 interview report documenting an interview with a Federal Bureau of Prisons correctional guard from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) regarding his duties and his lack of knowledge or involvement in the events surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death. The guard was not present at the MCC at the time of Epstein's discovery and death and reported no relevant information or rumors.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased inmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center whose death and the events surrounding it are the subject of the investigation. The interviewed guard stated he had no interaction with him.

events.title: Interview of MCC Correctional Guard
events.description: FBI, OIG, and AUSAs interviewed a Federal Bureau of Prisons correctional guard regarding his duties and his lack of knowledge about the events surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death.

events.title: Epstein's Discovery and Death
events.description: The incident where Jeffrey Epstein was discovered deceased in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

locations: New York, New York, United States
keyFacts: A Federal Bureau of Prisons correctional guard was interviewed by the FBI, OIG, and AUSAs on August 26, 2019, as part of the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death.
The guard had been stationed at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) since 2016 and was assigned to 'control' duties.
The guard was not working or present at the MCC at the time Epstein was discovered dead and stated he had heard no rumors or information about the incidents before or after Epstein's death.
The guard reported he never really had any interaction with Epstein as an inmate.
The document is an FBI 302 report, which is a summary of an investigative interview, and contains neither recommendations nor conclusions of the FBI.
